columns.comment: Specifies the soft delete data retention days. Value should be >=7 and <=90 when softDelete enabled, otherwise 0.

columns.name: recovery_level
columns.comment: The deletion recovery level currently in effect for the object. If it contains 'Purgeable', then the object can be permanently deleted by a privileged user; otherwise, only the system can purge the object at the end of the retention interval.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.comment: Specifies the time when the secret was last updated.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Specifies the secret value.

columns.comment: The provisioning state of the load balancer resource. Possible values include: 'Succeeded', 'Updating', 'Deleting', 'Failed'.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: The resource type.

columns.name: etag
columns.comment: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

columns.name: extended_location_name
columns.comment: The name of the extended location.

columns.name: extended_location_type
columns.comment: The type of the extended location. Possible values include: 'ExtendedLocationTypesEdgeZone'.

columns.name: resource_guid
columns.comment: The resource GUID property of the load balancer resource.

columns.name: sku_name
columns.comment: Name of the load balancer SKU. Possible values include: 'Basic', 'Standard', 'Gateway'.

columns.name: sku_tier
columns.comment: Tier of the load balancer SKU. Possible values include: 'Regional', 'Global'.

columns.name: backend_address_pools
columns.comment: Collection of backend address pools used by the load balancer.

columns.name: diagnostic_settings
columns.comment: A list of active diagnostic settings for the load balancer.

columns.name: frontend_ip_configurations
columns.comment: Object representing the frontend IPs to be used for the load balancer.

columns.name: inbound_nat_pools
columns.comment: Defines an external port range for inbound NAT to a single backend port on NICs associated with the load balancer. Inbound NAT rules are created automatically for each NIC associated with the Load Balancer using an external port from this range. Defining an Inbound NAT pool on the Load Balancer is mutually exclusive with defining inbound Nat rules. Inbound NAT pools are referenced from virtual machine scale sets. NICs that are associated with individual virtual machines cannot reference an inbound NAT pool. They have to reference individual inbound NAT rules.

columns.name: inbound_nat_rules
columns.comment: Collection of inbound NAT Rules used by the load balancer. Defining inbound NAT rules on the load balancer is mutually exclusive with defining an inbound NAT pool. Inbound NAT pools are referenced from virtual machine scale sets. NICs that are associated with individual virtual machines cannot reference an Inbound NAT pool. They have to reference individual inbound NAT rules.

columns.name: load_balancing_rules
columns.comment: Object collection representing the load balancing rules Gets the provisioning.

columns.name: outbound_rules
columns.comment: The outbound rules.

columns.name: probes
columns.comment: Collection of probe objects used in the load balancer.

columns.name: idle_timeout_in_minutes
columns.comment: The timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

columns.name: protocol
columns.comment: The protocol for the outbound rule in load balancer. Possible values include: 'LoadBalancerOutboundRuleProtocolTCP', 'LoadBalancerOutboundRuleProtocolUDP', 'LoadBalancerOutboundRuleProtocolAll'.

columns.name: backend_address_pools
columns.comment: A reference to a pool of DIPs. Outbound traffic is randomly load balanced across IPs in the backend IPs.

columns.name: frontend_ip_configurations
columns.comment: The Frontend IP addresses of the load balancer.

tables.comment: Azure Key Vault Managed Hardware Security Module

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The name of the managed HSM Pool.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The Azure Resource Manager resource ID for the managed HSM Pool.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: The resource type of the managed HSM Pool.

columns.name: provisioning_state
columns.comment: Provisioning state. Possible values include: 'ProvisioningStateSucceeded', 'ProvisioningStateProvisioning', 'ProvisioningStateFailed', 'ProvisioningStateUpdating', 'ProvisioningStateDeleting', 'ProvisioningStateActivated', 'ProvisioningStateSecurityDomainRestore', 'ProvisioningStateRestoring'.

columns.name: hsm_uri
columns.comment: The URI of the managed hsm pool for performing operations on keys.

columns.name: enable_soft_delete
columns.comment: Property to specify whether the 'soft delete' functionality is enabled for this managed HSM pool. If it's not set to any value(true or false) when creating new managed HSM pool, it will be set to true by default. Once set to true, it cannot be reverted to false.

columns.name: soft_delete_retention_in_days
columns.comment: Indicates softDelete data retention days. It accepts >=7 and <=90.

columns.name: enable_purge_protection
columns.comment: Property specifying whether protection against purge is enabled for this managed HSM pool. Setting this property to true activates protection against purge for this managed HSM pool and its content - only the Managed HSM service may initiate a hard, irrecoverable deletion. The setting is effective only if soft delete is also enabled. Enabling this functionality is irreversible.

columns.name: status_message
columns.comment: Resource Status Message.

columns.name: create_mode
columns.comment: The create mode to indicate whether the resource is being created or is being recovered from a deleted resource. Possible values include: 'CreateModeRecover', 'CreateModeDefault'.

columns.name: sku_family
columns.comment: Contains SKU family name.

columns.name: sku_name
columns.comment: SKU name to specify whether the key vault is a standard vault or a premium vault.

columns.name: tenant_id
columns.comment: The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault.

columns.name: diagnostic_settings
columns.comment: A list of active diagnostic settings for the managed HSM.

columns.comment: The maximum size of the share, in gigabytes. Must be greater than 0, and less than or equal to 5TB (5120). For Large File Shares, the maximum size is 102400.

columns.comment: The approximate size of the data stored on the share. Note that this value may not include all recently created or recently resized files.

columns.name: provisioning_state
columns.comment: The provisioning state of the container registry at the time the operation was called. Valid values are: 'Creating', 'Updating', 'Deleting', 'Succeeded', 'Failed', 'Canceled'.

columns.name: creation_date
columns.comment: The creation date of the container registry.

columns.name: admin_user_enabled
columns.comment: Indicates whether the admin user is enabled, or not.

columns.name: data_endpoint_enabled
columns.comment: Enable a single data endpoint per region for serving data.

columns.name: login_server
columns.comment: The URL that can be used to log into the container registry.

columns.name: network_rule_bypass_options
columns.comment: Indicates whether to allow trusted Azure services to access a network restricted registry. Valid values are: 'AzureServices', 'None'.

columns.name: public_network_access
columns.comment: Indicates whether or not public network access is allowed for the container registry. Valid values are: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'.

columns.name: sku_name
columns.comment: The SKU name of the container registry. Required for registry creation. Valid values are: 'Classic', 'Basic', 'Standard', 'Premium'.

columns.name: sku_tier
columns.comment: The SKU tier based on the SKU name. Valid values are: 'Classic', 'Basic', 'Standard', 'Premium'.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: The current status of the resource.

columns.name: status_message
columns.comment: The detailed message for the status, including alerts and error messages.

columns.name: status_timestamp
columns.comment: The timestamp when the status was changed to the current value.

columns.name: storage_account_id
columns.comment: The resource ID of the storage account. Only applicable to Classic SKU.

columns.name: zone_redundancy
columns.comment: Indicates whether or not zone redundancy is enabled for this container registry. Valid values are: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'.

columns.name: data_endpoint_host_names
columns.comment: A list of host names that will serve data when dataEndpointEnabled is true.

columns.name: encryption
columns.comment: The encryption settings of container registry.

columns.name: identity
columns.comment: The identity of the container registry.

columns.name: login_credentials
columns.comment: The login credentials for the specified container registry.

columns.name: network_rule_set
columns.comment: The network rule set for a container registry.

columns.name: policies
columns.comment: The policies for a container registry.

columns.name: private_endpoint_connections
columns.comment: A list of private endpoint connections for a container registry.

columns.name: system_data
columns.comment: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

columns.name: usages
columns.comment: Specifies the quota usages for the specified container registry.

columns.name: webhooks
columns.comment: Webhooks in Azure Container Registry provide a way to trigger custom actions in response to events happening within the registry.

columns.comment: Indicates the type of database account.

columns.comment: Type of the resource.

columns.comment: The cassandra connector offer type for the Cosmos DB database C* account.

columns.name: consistency_policy_max_interval
columns.comment: The time amount of staleness (in seconds) tolerated, when used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level.

columns.name: consistency_policy_max_staleness_prefix
columns.comment: The number of stale requests tolerated, when used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level.

columns.name: database_account_offer_type
columns.comment: The offer type for the Cosmos DB database account.

columns.name: default_consistency_level
columns.comment: The default consistency level and configuration settings of the Cosmos DB account.

columns.name: disable_key_based_metadata_write_access
columns.comment: Disable write operations on metadata resources (databases, containers, throughput) via account keys.

columns.name: document_endpoint
columns.comment: The connection endpoint for the Cosmos DB database account.

columns.name: enable_analytical_storage
columns.comment: Specifies whether to enable storage analytics, or not.

columns.name: enable_automatic_failover
columns.comment: Enables automatic failover of the write region in the rare event that the region is unavailable due to an outage.

columns.name: enable_cassandra_connector
columns.comment: Enables the cassandra connector on the Cosmos DB C* account.

columns.name: enable_free_tier
columns.comment: Specifies whether free Tier is enabled for Cosmos DB database account, or not.

columns.name: enable_multiple_write_locations
columns.comment: Enables the account to write in multiple locations.

columns.name: is_virtual_network_filter_enabled
columns.comment: Specifies whether to enable/disable Virtual Network ACL rules.

columns.name: disable_local_auth
columns.comment: Disable local authentication and ensure only MSI and AAD can be used exclusively for authentication. Defaults to false.

columns.name: key_vault_key_uri
columns.comment: The URI of the key vault, used to encrypt the Cosmos DB database account.

columns.name: provisioning_state
columns.comment: The provisioning state of the database account resource.

columns.name: public_network_access
columns.comment: Indicates whether requests from Public Network are allowed.

columns.name: server_version
columns.comment: Describes the ServerVersion of an a MongoDB account.

columns.name: backup_policy
columns.comment: The object representing the policy for taking backups on an account.

columns.name: capabilities
columns.comment: A list of Cosmos DB capabilities for the account.

columns.name: cors
columns.comment: A list of CORS policy for the Cosmos DB database account.

columns.name: failover_policies
columns.comment: A list of regions ordered by their failover priorities.

columns.name: ip_rules
columns.comment: A list of IP rules.

columns.name: locations
columns.comment: A list of all locations that are enabled for the Cosmos DB account.

columns.name: private_endpoint_connections
columns.comment: A list of Private Endpoint Connections configured for the Cosmos DB account.

columns.name: read_locations
columns.comment: A list of read locations enabled for the Cosmos DB account.

columns.name: restore_parameters
columns.comment: Parameters to indicate the information about the restore.

columns.name: virtual_network_rules
columns.comment: A list of Virtual Network ACL rules configured for the Cosmos DB account.

columns.name: write_locations
columns.comment: A list of write locations enabled for the Cosmos DB account.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The friendly name that identifies the server.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Contains ID to identify a server uniquely.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: The resource type of the server.

columns.name: state
columns.comment: The state of the server.

columns.name: version
columns.comment: Specifies the version of the server.

columns.name: user_visible_state
columns.comment: A state of a server that is visible to user. Possible values include: 'Ready', 'Dropping', 'Disabled', 'Inaccessible'.

columns.name: location
columns.comment: The resource location.

columns.name: administrator_login
columns.comment: Specifies the username of the administrator for this server.

columns.name: backup_retention_days
columns.comment: Backup retention days for the server.

columns.name: byok_enforcement
columns.comment: Status showing whether the server data encryption is enabled with customer-managed keys.

columns.name: earliest_restore_date
columns.comment: Specifies the earliest restore point creation time.

columns.name: fully_qualified_domain_name
columns.comment: The fully qualified domain name of the server.

columns.name: geo_redundant_backup
columns.comment: Indicates whether Geo-redundant is enabled, or not for server backup.

columns.name: infrastructure_encryption
columns.comment: Status showing whether the server enabled infrastructure encryption. Possible values include: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'.

columns.name: master_server_id
columns.comment: The master server id of a replica server.

columns.name: minimal_tls_version
columns.comment: Enforce a minimal Tls version for the server. Possible values include: 'TLS10', 'TLS11', 'TLS12', 'TLSEnforcementDisabled'.

columns.name: public_network_access
columns.comment: Indicates whether or not public network access is allowed for this server. Value is optional but if passed in, must be 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'. Possible values include: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'.

columns.name: replica_capacity
columns.comment: The maximum number of replicas that a master server can have.

columns.name: replication_role
columns.comment: The replication role of the server.

columns.name: sku_capacity
columns.comment: The scale up/out capacity, representing server's compute units.

columns.name: sku_family
columns.comment: The family of hardware.

columns.name: sku_name
columns.comment: The name of the sku. For example: 'B_Gen4_1', 'GP_Gen5_8'.

columns.name: sku_size
columns.comment: The size code, to be interpreted by resource as appropriate.

columns.name: sku_tier
columns.comment: The tier of the particular SKU. Possible values include: 'Basic', 'GeneralPurpose', 'MemoryOptimized'.

columns.name: ssl_enforcement
columns.comment: Enable ssl enforcement or not when connect to server. Possible values include: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'.

columns.name: storage_auto_grow
columns.comment: Indicates whether storage auto grow is enabled, or not.

columns.name: storage_mb
columns.comment: Indicates max storage allowed for a server.

columns.name: private_endpoint_connections
columns.comment: A list of private endpoint connections on a server.

columns.name: server_configurations
columns.comment: The server configurations(parameters) details of the server.

columns.name: server_keys
columns.comment: The server keys of the server.

columns.name: server_security_alert_policy
columns.comment: Security alert policy associated with the MySQL Server.

columns.name: vnet_rules
columns.comment: Rules represented by VNET.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: Name of the disk

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The unique id identifying the resource in subscription

columns.name: type
columns.comment: The type of the resource in Azure

columns.name: provisioning_state
columns.comment: The disk provisioning state

columns.name: managed_by
columns.comment: A relative URI containing the ID of the VM that has the disk attached

columns.name: sku_name
columns.comment: The disks sku name. Can be Standard_LRS, Premium_LRS, StandardSSD_LRS, or UltraSSD_LRS

columns.name: sku_tier
columns.comment: The sku tier

columns.name: time_created
columns.comment: The time when the disk was created

columns.name: unique_id
columns.comment: Unique Guid identifying the resource

columns.name: disk_access_id
columns.comment: ARM id of the DiskAccess resource for using private endpoints on disks

columns.name: disk_size_bytes
columns.comment: The size of the disk in bytes

columns.name: disk_size_gb
columns.comment: If this field is present for updates or creation with other options, it indicates a resize. Resizes are only allowed if the disk is not attached to a running VM, and can only increase the disk's size

columns.name: disk_state
columns.comment: This enumerates the possible state of the disk

columns.name: hyper_v_generation
columns.comment: The hypervisor generation of the Virtual Machine. Applicable to OS disks only

columns.name: disk_iops_read_only
columns.comment: The total number of IOPS that will be allowed across all VMs mounting the shared disk as ReadOnly. One operation can transfer between 4k and 256k bytes

columns.name: disk_iops_read_write
columns.comment: The number of IOPS allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. One operation can transfer between 4k and 256k bytes

columns.name: disk_iops_mbps_read_only
columns.comment: The total throughput (MBps) that will be allowed across all VMs mounting the shared disk as ReadOnly. MBps means millions of bytes per second - MB here uses the ISO notation, of powers of 10

columns.name: disk_iops_mbps_read_write
columns.comment: The bandwidth allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. MBps means millions of bytes per second - MB here uses the ISO notation, of powers of 10

columns.name: max_shares
columns.comment: The maximum number of VMs that can attach to the disk at the same time. Value greater than one indicates a disk that can be mounted on multiple VMs at the same time

columns.name: os_type
columns.comment: The Operating System type

columns.name: encryption_settings_collection_enabled
columns.comment: Shows the status of the encryption settings for the disk

columns.name: encryption_settings_collection_version
columns.comment: Describes the type of encryption is used for the disks. '1.0' corresponds to Azure Disk Encryption with AAD app. '1.1' corresponds to Azure Disk Encryption

columns.name: encryption_disk_encryption_set_id
columns.comment: ResourceId of the disk encryption set to use for enabling encryption at rest

columns.name: encryption_type
columns.comment: The type of key used to encrypt the data of the disk

columns.name: network_access_policy
columns.comment: Policy for accessing the disk via network

columns.name: creation_data_option
columns.comment: This enumerates the possible sources of a disk's creation

columns.name: creation_data_storage_account_id
columns.comment: The Azure Resource Manager identifier of the storage account containing the blob to import as a disk

columns.name: creation_data_source_uri
columns.comment: The URI of a blob to be imported into a managed disk

columns.name: creation_data_source_resource_id
columns.comment: The ARM id of the source snapshot or disk

columns.name: creation_data_source_unique_id
columns.comment: An unique id identifying the source of this resource

columns.name: creation_data_upload_size_bytes
columns.comment: This is the size of the contents of the upload including the VHD footer. This value should be between 20972032 (20 MiB + 512 bytes for the VHD footer) and 35183298347520 bytes (32 TiB + 512 bytes for the VHD footer)

columns.name: creation_data_image_reference_id
columns.comment: A relative uri containing either a Platform Image Repository or user image reference

columns.name: creation_data_image_reference_lun
columns.comment: If the disk is created from an image's data disk, this is an index that indicates which of the data disks in the image to use. For OS disks, this field is null

columns.name: creation_data_gallery_image_reference_id
columns.comment: The ARM id of the shared galley image version from which disk was created

columns.name: creation_data_gallery_image_reference_lun
columns.comment: An index that indicates which of the data disks in the image to use, if the disk is created from an image's data disk

columns.name: encryption_settings_collection_settings
columns.comment: A collection of encryption settings, one for each disk volume

columns.name: share_info
columns.comment: Details of the list of all VMs that have the disk attached

columns.name: zones
columns.comment: The Logical zone list for Disk

columns.name: managed_by_extended
columns.comment: List of relative URIs containing the IDs of the VMs that have the disk attached

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The name of the resource that is unique within the set of load balancing rules used by the load balancer. This name can be used to access the resource.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The resource ID.

columns.name: load_balancer_name
columns.comment: The friendly name that identifies the load balancer.

columns.name: provisioning_state
columns.comment: The provisioning state of the load balancing rule resource. Possible values include: 'Succeeded', 'Updating', 'Deleting', 'Failed'.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: Type of the resource.

columns.name: etag
columns.comment: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

columns.name: backend_address_pool_id
columns.comment: A reference to a pool of DIPs. Inbound traffic is randomly load balanced across IPs in the backend IPs.

columns.name: backend_port
columns.comment: The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Acceptable values are between 0 and 65535. Note that value 0 enables 'Any Port'.

columns.name: disable_outbound_snat
columns.comment: Configures SNAT for the VMs in the backend pool to use the publicIP address specified in the frontend of the load balancing rule.

columns.name: enable_floating_ip
columns.comment: Configures a virtual machine's endpoint for the floating IP capability required to configure a SQL AlwaysOn Availability Group. This setting is required when using the SQL AlwaysOn Availability Groups in SQL server. This setting can't be changed after you create the endpoint.

columns.name: enable_tcp_reset
columns.comment: Receive bidirectional TCP Reset on TCP flow idle timeout or unexpected connection termination. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

columns.name: frontend_ip_configuration_id
columns.comment: A reference to frontend IP addresses.

columns.name: frontend_port
columns.comment: The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Acceptable values are between 0 and 65534. Note that value 0 enables 'Any Port'.

columns.name: idle_timeout_in_minutes
columns.comment: The timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

columns.name: load_distribution
columns.comment: The load distribution policy for this rule. Possible values include: 'Default', 'SourceIP', 'SourceIPProtocol'.

columns.name: probe_id
columns.comment: The reference to the load balancer probe used by the load balancing rule.

columns.name: protocol
columns.comment: The reference to the transport protocol used by the load balancing rule. Possible values include: 'UDP', 'TCP', 'All'.

columns.name: backend_address_pools
columns.comment: An array of references to pool of DIPs.

tables.comment: Represents an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) service principal.

columns.name: display_name
columns.comment: The display name for the application.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The unique identifier for the application.

columns.name: app_id
columns.comment: The unique identifier for the application that is assigned to an application by Azure AD.

columns.name: created_date_time
columns.comment: The date and time the application was registered. The DateTimeOffset type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: Free text field to provide a description of the application object to end users.

columns.name: is_authorization_service_enabled
columns.comment: Is authorization service enabled.

columns.name: oauth2_require_post_response
columns.comment: Specifies whether, as part of OAuth 2.0 token requests, Azure AD allows POST requests, as opposed to GET requests. The default is false, which specifies that only GET requests are allowed.

columns.name: publisher_domain
columns.comment: The verified publisher domain for the application.

columns.name: sign_in_audience
columns.comment: Specifies the Microsoft accounts that are supported for the current application.

columns.name: api
columns.comment: Specifies settings for an application that implements a web API.

columns.name: identifier_uris
columns.comment: The URIs that identify the application within its Azure AD tenant, or within a verified custom domain if the application is multi-tenant.

columns.name: info
columns.comment: Basic profile information of the application such as app's marketing, support, terms of service and privacy statement URLs. The terms of service and privacy statement are surfaced to users through the user consent experience.

columns.name: key_credentials
columns.comment: The collection of key credentials associated with the application.

columns.name: owner_ids
columns.comment: Id of the owners of the application. The owners are a set of non-admin users who are allowed to modify this object.

columns.name: parental_control_settings
columns.comment: Specifies parental control settings for an application.

columns.name: password_credentials
columns.comment: The collection of password credentials associated with the application.

columns.name: spa
columns.comment: Specifies settings for a single-page application, including sign out URLs and redirect URIs for authorization codes and access tokens.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.comment: Custom strings that can be used to categorize and identify the application.

columns.name: web
columns.comment: Specifies settings for a web application.

columns.name: client_id
columns.comment: The client ID for the application. This is the client ID obtained when registering the application with the identity provider.

columns.name: client_secret
columns.comment: The client secret for the application. This is the client secret obtained when registering the application with the identity provider. This is write-only. A read operation will return ****.

tables.name: azuread.azuread_authorization_policy
tables.comment: Represents a policy that can control Azure Active Directory authorization settings.

columns.name: display_name
columns.comment: Display name for this policy.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: ID of the authorization policy.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: Description of this policy.

columns.name: allowed_to_sign_up_email_based_subscriptions
columns.comment: Indicates whether users can sign up for email based subscriptions.

columns.name: allowed_to_use_sspr
columns.comment: Indicates whether the Self-Serve Password Reset feature can be used by users on the tenant.

columns.name: allowed_email_verified_users_to_join_organization
columns.comment: Indicates whether a user can join the tenant by email validation.

columns.name: allow_invites_from
columns.comment: Indicates who can invite external users to the organization. Possible values are: none, adminsAndGuestInviters, adminsGuestInvitersAndAllMembers, everyone.

columns.name: block_msol_powershell
columns.comment: To disable the use of MSOL PowerShell set this property to true. This will also disable user-based access to the legacy service endpoint used by MSOL PowerShell. This does not affect Azure AD Connect or Microsoft Graph.

columns.name: guest_user_role_id
columns.comment: Represents role templateId for the role that should be granted to guest user.

columns.name: default_user_role_permissions
columns.comment: Specifies certain customizable permissions for default user role.

tables.name: azuread.azuread_service_principal
tables.comment: Represents an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) service principal.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The unique identifier for the service principal.

columns.name: display_name
columns.comment: The display name for the service principal.

columns.name: app_id
columns.comment: The unique identifier for the associated application (its appId property).

columns.name: account_enabled
columns.comment: true if the service principal account is enabled; otherwise, false.

columns.name: app_display_name
columns.comment: The display name exposed by the associated application.

columns.name: app_owner_organization_id
columns.comment: Contains the tenant id where the application is registered. This is applicable only to service principals backed by applications.

columns.name: app_role_assignment_required
columns.comment: Specifies whether users or other service principals need to be granted an app role assignment for this service principal before users can sign in or apps can get tokens. The default value is false.

columns.name: service_principal_type
columns.comment: Identifies whether the service principal represents an application, a managed identity, or a legacy application. This is set by Azure AD internally.

columns.name: sign_in_audience
columns.comment: Specifies the Microsoft accounts that are supported for the current application. Supported values are: AzureADMyOrg, AzureADMultipleOrgs, AzureADandPersonalMicrosoftAccount, PersonalMicrosoftAccount.

columns.name: app_description
columns.comment: The description exposed by the associated application.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: Free text field to provide an internal end-user facing description of the service principal.

columns.name: login_url
columns.comment: Specifies the URL where the service provider redirects the user to Azure AD to authenticate. Azure AD uses the URL to launch the application from Microsoft 365 or the Azure AD My Apps. When blank, Azure AD performs IdP-initiated sign-on for applications configured with SAML-based single sign-on.

columns.name: logout_url
columns.comment: Specifies the URL that will be used by Microsoft's authorization service to logout an user using OpenId Connect front-channel, back-channel or SAML logout protocols.

columns.name: add_ins
columns.comment: Defines custom behavior that a consuming service can use to call an app in specific contexts.

columns.name: alternative_names
columns.comment: Used to retrieve service principals by subscription, identify resource group and full resource ids for managed identities.

columns.name: app_roles
columns.comment: The roles exposed by the application which this service principal represents.

columns.name: info
columns.comment: Basic profile information of the acquired application such as app's marketing, support, terms of service and privacy statement URLs.

columns.name: key_credentials
columns.comment: The collection of key credentials associated with the service principal.

columns.name: notification_email_addresses
columns.comment: Specifies the list of email addresses where Azure AD sends a notification when the active certificate is near the expiration date. This is only for the certificates used to sign the SAML token issued for Azure AD Gallery applications.

columns.name: owner_ids
columns.comment: Id of the owners of the application. The owners are a set of non-admin users who are allowed to modify this object.

columns.name: password_credentials
columns.comment: Represents a password credential associated with a service principal.

columns.name: oauth2_permission_scopes
columns.comment: The published permission scopes.

columns.name: reply_urls
columns.comment: The URLs that user tokens are sent to for sign in with the associated application, or the redirect URIs that OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent to for the associated application.

columns.name: service_principal_names
columns.comment: Contains the list of identifiersUris, copied over from the associated application. Additional values can be added to hybrid applications. These values can be used to identify the permissions exposed by this app within Azure AD.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.comment: Custom strings that can be used to categorize and identify the service principal.

columns.name: tags
columns.comment: A map of tags for the resource.

columns.comment: Title of the resource.

tables.name: azuread.azuread_directory_audit_report
tables.comment: Represents the list of audit logs generated by Azure Active Directory.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Indicates the unique ID for the activity.

columns.name: activity_date_time
columns.comment: Indicates the date and time the activity was performed.

columns.name: activity_display_name
columns.comment: Indicates the activity name or the operation name.

columns.name: category
columns.comment: Indicates which resource category that's targeted by the activity.

columns.name: correlation_id
columns.comment: Indicates a unique ID that helps correlate activities that span across various services. Can be used to trace logs across services.

columns.name: logged_by_service
columns.comment: Indicates information on which service initiated the activity (For example: Self-service Password Management, Core Directory, B2C, Invited Users, Microsoft Identity Manager, Privileged Identity Management.

columns.name: operation_type
columns.comment: Indicates the type of operation that was performed. The possible values include but are not limited to the following: Add, Assign, Update, Unassign, and Delete.

columns.name: result
columns.comment: Indicates the result of the activity. Possible values are: success, failure, timeout, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: result_reason
columns.comment: Indicates the reason for failure if the result is failure or timeout.

columns.name: additional_details
columns.comment: Indicates additional details on the activity.

columns.name: initiated_by
columns.comment: Indicates information about the user or app initiated the activity.

columns.name: target_resources
columns.comment: Indicates information on which resource was changed due to the activity. Target Resource Type can be User, Device, Directory, App, Role, Group, Policy or Other.

columns.name: title
columns.comment: Title of the resource.

columns.name: tenant_id
columns.comment: The Azure Tenant ID where the resource is located.

tables.name: azuread.azuread_conditional_access_policy
tables.comment: Represents an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) Conditional Access Policy.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Specifies the identifier of a conditionalAccessPolicy object.

columns.name: display_name
columns.comment: Specifies a display name for the conditionalAccessPolicy object.

columns.name: state
columns.comment: Specifies the state of the conditionalAccessPolicy object. Possible values are: enabled, disabled, enabledForReportingButNotEnforced.

columns.name: created_date_time
columns.comment: The create date of the conditional access policy.

columns.name: modified_date_time
columns.comment: The modification date of the conditional access policy.

columns.name: operator
columns.comment: Defines the relationship of the grant controls. Possible values: AND, OR.

columns.name: applications
columns.comment: Applications and user actions included in and excluded from the policy.

columns.name: application_enforced_restrictions
columns.comment: Session control to enforce application restrictions. Only Exchange Online and Sharepoint Online support this session control.

columns.name: built_in_controls
columns.comment: List of values of built-in controls required by the policy. Possible values: block, mfa, compliantDevice, domainJoinedDevice, approvedApplication, compliantApplication, passwordChange, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: client_app_types
columns.comment: Client application types included in the policy. Possible values are: all, browser, mobileAppsAndDesktopClients, exchangeActiveSync, easSupported, other.

columns.name: custom_authentication_factors
columns.comment: List of custom controls IDs required by the policy.

columns.name: cloud_app_security
columns.comment: Session control to apply cloud app security.

columns.name: locations
columns.comment: Locations included in and excluded from the policy.

columns.name: persistent_browser
columns.comment: Session control to define whether to persist cookies or not. All apps should be selected for this session control to work correctly.

columns.name: platforms
columns.comment: Platforms included in and excluded from the policy.

columns.name: sign_in_frequency
columns.comment: Session control to enforce signin frequency.

columns.name: sign_in_risk_levels
columns.comment: Sign-in risk levels included in the policy. Possible values are: low, medium, high, hidden, none, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: terms_of_use
columns.comment: List of terms of use IDs required by the policy.

columns.name: users
columns.comment: Users, groups, and roles included in and excluded from the policy.

columns.name: user_risk_levels
columns.comment: User risk levels included in the policy. Possible values are: low, medium, high, hidden, none, unknownFutureValue.

tables.name: azuread.azuread_sign_in_report
tables.comment: Represents an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) sign-in report.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique ID representing the sign-in activity.

columns.name: created_date_time
columns.comment: Date and time (UTC) the sign-in was initiated.

columns.name: user_display_name
columns.comment: Display name of the user that initiated the sign-in.

columns.name: user_principal_name
columns.comment: User principal name of the user that initiated the sign-in.

columns.name: user_id
columns.comment: ID of the user that initiated the sign-in.

columns.name: app_id
columns.comment: Unique GUID representing the app ID in the Azure Active Directory.

columns.name: app_display_name
columns.comment: App name displayed in the Azure Portal.

columns.name: ip_address
columns.comment: IP address of the client used to sign in.

columns.name: client_app_used
columns.comment: Identifies the legacy client used for sign-in activity.

columns.name: correlation_id
columns.comment: The request ID sent from the client when the sign-in is initiated; used to troubleshoot sign-in activity.

columns.name: conditional_access_status
columns.comment: Reports status of an activated conditional access policy. Possible values are: success, failure, notApplied, and unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: is_interactive
columns.comment: Indicates if a sign-in is interactive or not.

columns.name: risk_detail
columns.comment: Provides the 'reason' behind a specific state of a risky user, sign-in or a risk event. The possible values are: none, adminGeneratedTemporaryPassword, userPerformedSecuredPasswordChange, userPerformedSecuredPasswordReset, adminConfirmedSigninSafe, aiConfirmedSigninSafe, userPassedMFADrivenByRiskBasedPolicy, adminDismissedAllRiskForUser, adminConfirmedSigninCompromised, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: risk_level_aggregated
columns.comment: Aggregated risk level. The possible values are: none, low, medium, high, hidden, and unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: risk_level_during_sign_in
columns.comment: Risk level during sign-in. The possible values are: none, low, medium, high, hidden, and unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: risk_state
columns.comment: Reports status of the risky user, sign-in, or a risk event. The possible values are: none, confirmedSafe, remediated, dismissed, atRisk, confirmedCompromised, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: resource_display_name
columns.comment: Name of the resource the user signed into.

columns.name: resource_id
columns.comment: ID of the resource that the user signed into.

columns.name: risk_event_types
columns.comment: Risk event types associated with the sign-in. The possible values are: unlikelyTravel, anonymizedIPAddress, maliciousIPAddress, unfamiliarFeatures, malwareInfectedIPAddress, suspiciousIPAddress, leakedCredentials, investigationsThreatIntelligence, generic, and unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: Sign-in status. Includes the error code and description of the error (in case of a sign-in failure).

columns.name: device_detail
columns.comment: Device information from where the sign-in occurred; includes device ID, operating system, and browser.

columns.name: location
columns.comment: Provides the city, state, and country code where the sign-in originated.

columns.name: applied_conditional_access_policies
columns.comment: Provides a list of conditional access policies that are triggered by the corresponding sign-in activity.

columns.name: title
columns.comment: Title of the resource.

columns.name: tenant_id

columns.name: og_account_id

columns.comment: The unique ID of the resource in opengovernance.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The unique identifier for the device. Inherited from directoryObject.

columns.name: display_name
columns.comment: The name displayed for the device.

columns.name: account_enabled
columns.comment: True if the account is enabled; otherwise, false.

columns.name: device_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier set by Azure Device Registration Service at the time of registration.

columns.name: approximate_last_sign_in_date_time
columns.comment: The timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time.

columns.name: filter
columns.comment: Odata query to search for resources.

columns.name: is_compliant
columns.comment: True if the device is compliant; otherwise, false.

columns.name: is_managed
columns.comment: True if the device is managed; otherwise, false.

columns.name: mdm_app_id
columns.comment: Application identifier used to register device into MDM.

columns.name: operating_system
columns.comment: The type of operating system on the device.

columns.name: operating_system_version
columns.comment: The version of the operating system on the device.

columns.name: profile_type
columns.comment: A string value that can be used to classify device types.

columns.name: trust_type
columns.comment: Type of trust for the joined device. Possible values: Workplace (indicates bring your own personal devices), AzureAd (Cloud only joined devices), ServerAd (on-premises domain joined devices joined to Azure AD).

columns.name: extension_attributes
columns.comment: Contains extension attributes 1-15 for the device. The individual extension attributes are not selectable. These properties are mastered in cloud and can be set during creation or update of a device object in Azure AD.

columns.name: member_of
columns.comment: A list the groups and directory roles that the device is a direct member of.

tables.name: azuread.azuread_domain
tables.comment: Represents an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) domain.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The fully qualified name of the domain.

columns.name: authentication_type
columns.comment: Indicates the configured authentication type for the domain. The value is either Managed or Federated. Managed indicates a cloud managed domain where Azure AD performs user authentication. Federated indicates authentication is federated with an identity provider such as the tenant's on-premises Active Directory via Active Directory Federation Services.

columns.name: is_default
columns.comment: true if this is the default domain that is used for user creation. There is only one default domain per company.

columns.name: is_admin_managed
columns.comment: The value of the property is false if the DNS record management of the domain has been delegated to Microsoft 365. Otherwise, the value is true.

columns.name: is_initial
columns.comment: true if this is the initial domain created by Microsoft Online Services (companyname.onmicrosoft.com). There is only one initial domain per company.

columns.name: is_root
columns.comment: true if the domain is a verified root domain. Otherwise, false if the domain is a subdomain or unverified.

columns.name: is_verified
columns.comment: true if the domain has completed domain ownership verification.

columns.name: supported_services
columns.comment: The capabilities assigned to the domain. Can include 0, 1 or more of following values: Email, Sharepoint, EmailInternalRelayOnly, OfficeCommunicationsOnline, SharePointDefaultDomain, FullRedelegation, SharePointPublic, OrgIdAuthentication, Yammer, Intune. The values which you can add/remove using Graph API include: Email, OfficeCommunicationsOnline, Yammer.

columns.name: title
columns.comment: Title of the resource.

columns.name: tenant_id
columns.comment: The Azure Tenant ID where the resource is located.

columns.name: og_account_id
columns.comment: The Platform Account ID in which the resource is located.

columns.name: og_resource_id
columns.comment: The unique ID of the resource in opengovernance.

columns.name: kaytu_description
columns.comment: The full model description of the resource

columns.name: sp_connection_name
columns.comment: Steampipe connection name.

columns.name: sp_ctx
columns.comment: Steampipe context in JSON form.

columns.name: _ctx
columns.comment: Steampipe context in JSON form.

columns.name: display_name
columns.comment: The name displayed in the address book for the user. This is usually the combination of the user's first name, middle initial and last name.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The unique identifier for the group.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An optional description for the group.

columns.name: classification
columns.comment: Describes a classification for the group (such as low, medium or high business impact).

columns.name: created_date_time
columns.comment: The time at which the group was created.

columns.name: expiration_date_time
columns.comment: Timestamp of when the group is set to expire.

columns.name: is_assignable_to_role
columns.comment: Indicates whether this group can be assigned to an Azure Active Directory role or not.

columns.name: is_subscribed_by_mail
columns.comment: Indicates whether the signed-in user is subscribed to receive email conversations. Default value is true.

columns.name: mail
columns.comment: The SMTP address for the group, for example, "serviceadmins@contoso.onmicrosoft.com".

columns.name: mail_enabled
columns.comment: Specifies whether the group is mail-enabled.

columns.name: mail_nickname
columns.comment: The mail alias for the user.

columns.name: membership_rule
columns.comment: The mail alias for the group, unique in the organization.

columns.name: membership_rule_processing_state
columns.comment: Indicates whether the dynamic membership processing is on or paused. Possible values are On or Paused.

columns.name: on_premises_domain_name
columns.comment: Contains the on-premises Domain name synchronized from the on-premises directory.

columns.name: on_premises_last_sync_date_time
columns.comment: Indicates the last time at which the group was synced with the on-premises directory.

columns.name: on_premises_net_bios_name
columns.comment: Contains the on-premises NetBiosName synchronized from the on-premises directory.

columns.name: on_premises_sam_account_name
columns.comment: Contains the on-premises SAM account name synchronized from the on-premises directory.

columns.name: on_premises_security_identifier
columns.comment: Contains the on-premises security identifier (SID) for the group that was synchronized from on-premises to the cloud.

columns.name: on_premises_sync_enabled
columns.comment: True if this group is synced from an on-premises directory; false if this group was originally synced from an on-premises directory but is no longer synced; null if this object has never been synced from an on-premises directory (default).

columns.name: renewed_date_time
columns.comment: Timestamp of when the group was last renewed. This cannot be modified directly and is only updated via the renew service action.

columns.name: security_enabled
columns.comment: Specifies whether the group is a security group.

columns.name: security_identifier
columns.comment: Security identifier of the group, used in Windows scenarios.

columns.name: visibility
columns.comment: Specifies the group join policy and group content visibility for groups. Possible values are: Private, Public, or Hiddenmembership.

columns.name: assigned_labels
columns.comment: The list of sensitivity label pairs (label ID, label name) associated with a Microsoft 365 group.

columns.name: group_types
columns.comment: Specifies the group type and its membership. If the collection contains Unified, the group is a Microsoft 365 group; otherwise, it's either a security group or distribution group. For details, see [groups overview](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/resources/groups-overview?view=graph-rest-1.0).

columns.name: member_ids
columns.comment: Id of Users and groups that are members of this group.

columns.name: owner_ids
columns.comment: Id od the owners of the group. The owners are a set of non-admin users who are allowed to modify this object.

columns.name: proxy_addresses
columns.comment: Email addresses for the group that direct to the same group mailbox. For example: ["SMTP: bob@contoso.com", "smtp: bob@sales.contoso.com"]. The any operator is required to filter expressions on multi-valued properties.

columns.name: resource_behavior_options
columns.comment: Specifies the group behaviors that can be set for a Microsoft 365 group during creation. Possible values are AllowOnlyMembersToPost, HideGroupInOutlook, SubscribeNewGroupMembers, WelcomeEmailDisabled.

columns.name: resource_provisioning_options
columns.comment: Specifies the group resources that are provisioned as part of Microsoft 365 group creation, that are not normally part of default group creation. Possible value is Team.

columns.name: nested_groups
columns.comment: Members which are group.

columns.comment: Contains the tenant id where the application is registered. This is applicable only to service principals backed by applications.

columns.name: app_role_assignment_required
columns.comment: Specifies whether users or other service principals need to be granted an app role assignment for this service principal before users can sign in or apps can get tokens. The default value is false.

columns.name: identity_type
columns.comment: Identifies whether the Managed Identity is SystemAssigned or UserAssigned

columns.name: sign_in_audience
columns.comment: Specifies the Microsoft accounts that are supported for the current application. Supported values are: AzureADMyOrg, AzureADMultipleOrgs, AzureADandPersonalMicrosoftAccount, PersonalMicrosoftAccount.

columns.name: app_description
columns.comment: The description exposed by the associated application.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: Free text field to provide an internal end-user facing description of the service principal.

columns.name: login_url
columns.comment: Specifies the URL where the service provider redirects the user to Azure AD to authenticate. Azure AD uses the URL to launch the application from Microsoft 365 or the Azure AD My Apps. When blank, Azure AD performs IdP-initiated sign-on for applications configured with SAML-based single sign-on.

columns.name: logout_url
columns.comment: Specifies the URL that will be used by Microsoft's authorization service to logout an user using OpenId Connect front-channel, back-channel or SAML logout protocols.

columns.name: add_ins
columns.comment: Defines custom behavior that a consuming service can use to call an app in specific contexts.

columns.name: alternative_names
columns.comment: Used to retrieve service principals by subscription, identify resource group and full resource ids for managed identities.

columns.name: app_roles
columns.comment: The roles exposed by the application which this service principal represents.

columns.name: info
columns.comment: Basic profile information of the acquired application such as app's marketing, support, terms of service and privacy statement URLs.

columns.name: key_credentials
columns.comment: The collection of key credentials associated with the service principal.

columns.name: notification_email_addresses
columns.comment: Specifies the list of email addresses where Azure AD sends a notification when the active certificate is near the expiration date. This is only for the certificates used to sign the SAML token issued for Azure AD Gallery applications.

columns.name: owner_ids
columns.comment: Id of the owners of the application. The owners are a set of non-admin users who are allowed to modify this object.

columns.name: password_credentials
columns.comment: Represents a password credential associated with a service principal.

columns.name: oauth2_permission_scopes
columns.comment: The published permission scopes.

columns.name: reply_urls
columns.comment: The URLs that user tokens are sent to for sign in with the associated application, or the redirect URIs that OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent to for the associated application.

columns.name: service_principal_names
columns.comment: Contains the list of identifiersUris, copied over from the associated application. Additional values can be added to hybrid applications. These values can be used to identify the permissions exposed by this app within Azure AD.

columns.comment: Custom strings that can be used to categorize and identify the service principal.

tables.name: azuread.azuread_user
tables.comment: Represents an Azure AD user account.

columns.name: display_name
columns.comment: The name displayed in the address book for the user. This is usually the combination of the user's first name, middle initial and last name.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The unique identifier for the user. Should be treated as an opaque identifier.

columns.name: user_principal_name
columns.comment: Principal email of the active directory user.

columns.name: account_enabled
columns.comment: True if the account is enabled; otherwise, false.

columns.name: created_date_time
columns.comment: The time at which the user was created.

columns.name: last_sign_in_date_time
columns.comment: The time at which the user was last signed in.

columns.name: user_type
columns.comment: A string value that can be used to classify user types in your directory.

columns.name: mail
columns.comment: The SMTP address for the user, for example, jeff@contoso.onmicrosoft.com.

columns.name: job_title
columns.comment: The user job title.

columns.name: identities
columns.comment: User identities

columns.name: password_policies
columns.comment: Specifies password policies for the user. This value is an enumeration with one possible value being DisableStrongPassword, which allows weaker passwords than the default policy to be specified. DisablePasswordExpiration can also be specified. The two may be specified together; for example: DisablePasswordExpiration, DisableStrongPassword.

columns.name: sign_in_sessions_valid_from_date_time
columns.comment: Any refresh tokens or sessions tokens (session cookies) issued before this time are invalid, and applications will get an error when using an invalid refresh or sessions token to acquire a delegated access token (to access APIs such as Microsoft Graph).

columns.name: usage_location
columns.comment: A two letter country code (ISO standard 3166), required for users that will be assigned licenses due to legal requirement to check for availability of services in countries.

columns.name: im_addresses
columns.comment: The instant message voice over IP (VOIP) session initiation protocol (SIP) addresses for the user.

columns.name: other_mails
columns.comment: A list of additional email addresses for the user.

tables.name: public.s3_state
tables.def:
CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW s3_state AS (
 SELECT b.name,
    b.arn,
    b.creation_date,
    b.bucket_policy_is_public,
    b.versioning_enabled,
    b.versioning_mfa_delete,
    b.block_public_acls,
    b.block_public_policy,
    b.ignore_public_acls,
    b.restrict_public_buckets,
    b.event_notification_configuration,
    b.server_side_encryption_configuration,
    b.acl,
    b.lifecycle_rules,
    b.logging,
    b.object_lock_configuration,
    b.object_ownership_controls,
    b.policy,
    b.policy_std,
    b.replication,
    b.website_configuration,
    b.tags_src,
    b.tags,
    b.title,
    b.akas,
    b.region,
    b.partition,
    b.account_id,
    b.og_account_id,
    b.og_resource_id,
    b.og_metadata,
    b.og_description,
    b._ctx
   FROM (aws_s3_bucket b
     JOIN aws_account a ON ((b.account_id = a.account_id)))
  WHERE (((b.name ~~* '%tfstate%'::text) OR (b.name ~~* '%trail%'::text) OR (b.name ~~* '%templates%'::text)) AND ((a.name ~~* '%HealthDataManager%'::text) OR (a.name ~~* '%hdm%'::text) OR (a.name ~~* '%ADorigi%'::text)))
)
